overview: John Birks 'Dizzy' Gillespie was a demi-God of 20th Century jazz, pioneering the revolution that was be-bop.  And he was still pushing out the boundaries at Perception Records in 1970-71, fusing jazz and funk in breathtaking style.  Named after an oft-sampled dancefloor classic, "Matrix" boast three Dizzy albums; the in-demand "The Real Thing," the more contemplative "Portrait Of Jenny" and the in-concert recording, "Giants".
title: Dizzy Gillespie:  Matrix
